intro: Elatostema petiolare, commonly known as the spurred spleenwort, is a small, herbaceous plant belonging to the family Urticaceae. It is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are usually oval to ovate in shape. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in clusters, which are typically borne on short pedicels. Elatostema petiolare is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky crevices. Its unique botanical features make it an interesting subject for botanical study and conservation efforts.
